_header: Who that cometh to an house
_description: Advice to take what you can find or what you bring — one 6-line stanza accompanied with Latin

Bod315.Note:
Occurs with 1879, 2711, 4102, 6644; all
                    originally copied from Cornwall,  olim Launceston Priory,  a wall inscription, no longer visible.
Bod315.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Wall Verses at Launceston Priory.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         200 (1963): 338-43: 342.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 562.

CamTCC1450.Transcription:
hoo that comyȝt to an howseloke he be noo thynge
                    dongerowseTo take soche as he fyndyȝtAnd yf he woll not do
                    soReson a greeȝt there tooTo take suche as he
                    bryngyȝt
CamTCC1450.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Babees Book, etc.
EETS
         o.s. 32 (1868); rev. ed.  Early English Meals and
                Manners London: Trübner, 1876; repr. 1973: 35 (orig. ed.).
